intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. puricolor, commonly known as the purple meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its striking purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are surrounded by pale yellow to white ray florets. The subspecies is distinguished by its more intense purple coloration compared to other variants of Hieracium murorum.
